title: modin.pandas.Series.sub | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Return Subtraction of series and other, element-wise (binary operator sub).

Equivalent to series - other, but with support to substitute a fill_value for
missing data in either one of the inputs.

level (int or name) – Broadcast across a level, matching Index values on the
passed MultiIndex level.

fill_value (None or float value, default None (NaN)) – Fill existing missing (NaN) values, and any new element needed for
successful Series alignment, with this value before computation.
If data in both corresponding Series locations is missing
the result of filling (at that location) will be missing.
axis ({0 or 'index'}) – Unused. Parameter needed for compatibility with DataFrame.
Reverse of the Subtraction operator, see Python documentation for more details.
In Snowpark pandas API, whenever a binary operation involves a NULL value, the result will preserve NULL values, e.g. NULL.sub(<other>) will yield NULL.
Snowpark pandas API denotes invalid numeric results with None while pandas uses NaN.
Snowpark pandas API does not support fill_value and level except for default values.
